newsitem.title: ABU DHABI: UAE announces new government.
newsitem.headline: UAE announces new government.

text.p: United Arab Emirates President Sheikh Zaid bin Sultan al-Nahayan on Tuesday announced the formation of a new government led by the same prime minister, Sheikh Maktoum bin Rashid al-Maktoum.
The official news agency WAM said he appointed a new oil minister, Obaid bin Saif al-Nasseri, but re-appointed the key ministers of defence, foreign affairs and finance.
The new oil minister replaced Rakad bin Salem bin Rakad, public works and housing minister who held the title of acting oil minister.
Sheikh Zaid appointed a new minister of economy and commerce -- Sheikh Fahem bin Sultan al-Qassimi -- to replace Said Ghobash.
He also appointed Sheikh Abdullah bin Zaid al-Nahayan, one of his younger sons, as minister of information and culture.
The former cabinet appointed in November 1990 resigned on March 16.
